Marketing & Sales Representative Job at Coinbox Limited




        
    

        
        Coinbox Limited is a multi-dimensional Consulting Firm which provides one - stop total business development and support to our vast clientele of start-ups, Small, Medium, growing and Large Enterprises, Cooperative Societies, Groups and Associations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing & Sales Representative

Job Location: Iju-Ishaga, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The preferred candidate must be a results-driven individual, with the capacity to bring in new clients through outdoor marketing, strategic networking, and other effective marketing and sales strategies. 


Key Responsibilities


	Setting up strategy to find new prospects and sales leads and convert them to paid customers, with effective executable plans.
	Identifying business opportunities (in big, medium and small sized organizations, as well as with appropriate Groups, Associations and Individuals) by educating prospective clients about the unique selling points and clear advantages and edge of our Platforms/products and services.
	Selling competently the Company’s 12 hospitality platforms - events halls, rooms/apartments, conference rooms, gym, swimming pool, restaurant, etc.
	Solicit new clients by visiting the right prospects and initiating and sustaining contacts and attraction with social media.
	Communicating with current customers for retention, and the potential clients for attraction, understanding their needs and offering the required solutions.
	Creating long-lasting relationships with current and potential customers.
	Maintaining positive business relationships to ensure future sales.
	Devise upcoming in-house events in collaboration with the operational leadership.
	Empowering the whole company (team) to be a part of delivering sales revenues.
	Preparing regular reports by collecting, analyzing/reviewing and summarizing information.


Requirements


	Minimum of a BSc. /HND degree in Marketing or an associated field and/or in a relevant field
	Track records in marketing and in delivering excellent practical sales results, especially in the hospitality industry.
	Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite/packages.
	In-depth understanding of marketing & sales strategy and techniques.
	Excellent communication skills - oral and written English.
	Analytical and multitasking skills.
	Good team player.


Salary
N200,000 - 300,000 Monthly.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Logistics Manager",
  "description": "Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains &amp; oilseeds, animal feed &amp; protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains &amp; seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Logistics Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilorin, Kwara
Function:&nbsp; Non Commodity Procurement
Sub-Function:&nbsp; Non Commodity Procurement

Summary


	The Logistics Manager plays a critical role within Olam&#39;s supply chain operations, overseeing and optimizing the end-to-end movement of goods&mdash;from sourcing to delivery.
	This strategic role demands strong execution capabilities and the ability to manage complex logistics networks while ensuring cost-effectiveness, efficiency, and compliance.
	The Logistics Manager will collaborate closely with internal departments (sourcing, production, sales, finance) and external stakeholders (suppliers, transporters, freight forwarders, customs brokers) to ensure the seamless and timely flow of materials and finished products.
	The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of logistics principles, strong negotiation skills, excellent problem-solving abilities, and a commitment to Olam&rsquo;s core values:&nbsp;&nbsp;Collaborative, Agile, Resourceful, Entrepreneurial, and Sustainable.


Key Deliverables
Strategic Planning &amp; Optimization:


	Develop and implement logistics strategies, policies, and procedures aligned with Olam&rsquo;s business objectives.
	Continuously identify opportunities for process improvement, cost reduction, and enhanced efficiency across the logistics network.


Transportation Management:


	Oversee all transportation activities, including carrier selection, rate and contract negotiation, route optimization, shipment tracking, and performance monitoring.
	Ensure timely and cost-effective movement of goods via road, rail, sea, and air.


Warehouse &amp; Inventory Management:


	Manage warehouse operations, including storage, handling, and inventory control.
	Implement best practices for layout, space utilization, and inventory accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with safety regulations and quality standards.


Customs &amp; Compliance:


	Ensure adherence to customs regulations, import/export laws, and trade compliance requirements.
	Manage relationships with customs brokers and ensure timely, accurate documentation.


Stakeholder Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including suppliers, carriers, freight forwarders, warehouse providers, and regulatory authorities.
	Communicate effectively to resolve issues and ensure smooth operations.


Strategic Effectiveness:
Performance Monitoring &amp; Reporting:


	Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as on-time delivery, transportation costs, warehouse efficiency, and inventory accuracy.
	Prepare regular management reports highlighting performance and areas for improvement.


Budget Management:


	Develop and manage the logistics budget, ensuring cost control and alignment with financial targets.
	Identify and implement cost-saving initiatives.


Risk Management:


	Identify potential risks in logistics operations and develop mitigation strategies.
	Ensure business continuity plans are in place.


Team Leadership &amp; Development:


	Lead, mentor, and develop the logistics team (if applicable), fostering a collaborative and high-performing work environment.


Technology Adoption:


	Evaluate and implement logistics technologies and systems to improve efficiency, visibility, and decision-making.


Sustainability in Logistics:


	Identify and implement sustainable logistics practices, considering environmental impact, ethical sourcing, and long-term viability.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field. A Master&rsquo;s degree or professional certifications (e.g., CSCP, CLTD) are advantageous.
	Minimum of 7 years of progressive experience in logistics and supply chain management, preferably within a multinational organization or logistics company.
	Proven experience in managing complex logistics operations, including transportation, warehousing, and customs.
	Strong understanding of logistics principles, practices, and regulations.
	Proficiency in logistics software and systems (e.g., TMS, WMS, ERP modules).
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
	Strong negotiation and contract management skills.
	Knowledge of international trade and customs procedures.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels.
	Adaptability and resilience in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
	Other Requirements:&nbsp;Willingness to travel as required.

Logistics Manager Job at Olam Agri




        
    

        
        Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains & oilseeds, animal feed & protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains & seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Manager

Job Location: Ilorin, Kwara
Function:  Non Commodity Procurement
Sub-Function:  Non Commodity Procurement

Summary


	The Logistics Manager plays a critical role within Olam's supply chain operations, overseeing and optimizing the end-to-end movement of goods—from sourcing to delivery.
	This strategic role demands strong execution capabilities and the ability to manage complex logistics networks while ensuring cost-effectiveness, efficiency, and compliance.
	The Logistics Manager will collaborate closely with internal departments (sourcing, production, sales, finance) and external stakeholders (suppliers, transporters, freight forwarders, customs brokers) to ensure the seamless and timely flow of materials and finished products.
	The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of logistics principles, strong negotiation skills, excellent problem-solving abilities, and a commitment to Olam’s core values:  Collaborative, Agile, Resourceful, Entrepreneurial, and Sustainable.


Key Deliverables
Strategic Planning & Optimization:


	Develop and implement logistics strategies, policies, and procedures aligned with Olam’s business objectives.
	Continuously identify opportunities for process improvement, cost reduction, and enhanced efficiency across the logistics network.


Transportation Management:


	Oversee all transportation activities, including carrier selection, rate and contract negotiation, route optimization, shipment tracking, and performance monitoring.
	Ensure timely and cost-effective movement of goods via road, rail, sea, and air.


Warehouse & Inventory Management:


	Manage warehouse operations, including storage, handling, and inventory control.
	Implement best practices for layout, space utilization, and inventory accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with safety regulations and quality standards.


Customs & Compliance:


	Ensure adherence to customs regulations, import/export laws, and trade compliance requirements.
	Manage relationships with customs brokers and ensure timely, accurate documentation.


Stakeholder Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including suppliers, carriers, freight forwarders, warehouse providers, and regulatory authorities.
	Communicate effectively to resolve issues and ensure smooth operations.


Strategic Effectiveness:
Performance Monitoring & Reporting:


	Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as on-time delivery, transportation costs, warehouse efficiency, and inventory accuracy.
	Prepare regular management reports highlighting performance and areas for improvement.


Budget Management:


	Develop and manage the logistics budget, ensuring cost control and alignment with financial targets.
	Identify and implement cost-saving initiatives.


Risk Management:


	Identify potential risks in logistics operations and develop mitigation strategies.
	Ensure business continuity plans are in place.


Team Leadership & Development:


	Lead, mentor, and develop the logistics team (if applicable), fostering a collaborative and high-performing work environment.


Technology Adoption:


	Evaluate and implement logistics technologies and systems to improve efficiency, visibility, and decision-making.


Sustainability in Logistics:


	Identify and implement sustainable logistics practices, considering environmental impact, ethical sourcing, and long-term viability.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field. A Master’s degree or professional certifications (e.g., CSCP, CLTD) are advantageous.
	Minimum of 7 years of progressive experience in logistics and supply chain management, preferably within a multinational organization or logistics company.
	Proven experience in managing complex logistics operations, including transportation, warehousing, and customs.
	Strong understanding of logistics principles, practices, and regulations.
	Proficiency in logistics software and systems (e.g., TMS, WMS, ERP modules).
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
	Strong negotiation and contract management skills.
	Knowledge of international trade and customs procedures.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels.
	Adaptability and resilience in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
	Other Requirements: Willingness to travel as required.
